intro: Haeupleria, commonly known as the narrow-leafed haeupleria, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in various habitats including fynbos vegetation. The plants are characterized by their narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers. Haeupleria species are typically shrubs or small trees, with some species reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to their ornamental value and ecological significance, they are of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
